reviews.review_text: We made a reservation as this place does get very busy. All the food was really yummy! I recommend the stuffed chicken wings and the crying tiger beef as some of the best things we tried. The coconut rice was literally the best rice Ive ever eaten in my entire life, you should definitely pair it with your curries or even eat it alone

One of our favorite places! The food is outstanding and the service is top notch. Have been coming here for 20+ years. Weve moved out of the neighborhood, however we still drive in to dine at Sawasdee Thai. Run by a lovely family, we literally feel like family every time we come in. Highly recommend the red chicken curry, chicken fried rice, coconut rice, garlic beef, cashew chicken, and the pad thai   Hands down the best Thai food in Vancouver

This is some of the best Thai food I ve had in Vancouver, if not the best. I highly recommend eating here. I love their Pad Thai and Roasted Duck Curry. Service here is also great. The man on the line was able to get my group a last minute reservation by moving some tables around.

Food was delicious, services was very good and I loved the fact I didn t had a reservation and although they were all booked for dinner they make it possible for me to have a quick bite. Food came super fast and was amazing. I recommend the curries and the stir fry

Still Vancouver s best Thai restaurant! Haven t been in years because I live so far but decided to come here for dinner with my family. Food is still as good as I remembered and the service is top notch! Tried the crying tiger beef plater and it s definitely my favorite dish. Also, everything is so well priced, it s not expensive and the portions are big. Can t wait to go back and try their new boat noodles for lunch.

Pros: Highly recommend Thai Restaurant in Vancouver. The food is excellent! We tried Pad Thai, Pad Thai woon sen, Thai (Chicken) Satay and Thai Tea. Reserving a table is necessary because they are always fully booked. The staff are great in customer service. Cons: The venue is an open area (without walls separating the tables) so it may be irritating if other customers talk very loudly without considering other customers.
Everything is flavourful! Great service. We will go back again. They will open for lunch from tomorrow. Can t wait to have their Thai boat noodle soup !

All of the dishes are delicious, and I highly recommend trying their braised pork and cauliflower. For drinks, the Thai-style milk tea is a must-try. The prices are also very reasonable, averaging around 15-20 dollars per person, and you can have a very filling meal. Plus, you can also take some leftovers home with you.

I walked into this store by accident and found that this is the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to. They were very busy but the service was fast. I ordered four dishes, all of them were really good. I strongly recommend the pineapple fried rice. And the Chi Chi cocktail was amazing as well.

Hit it   ! One of my favorite Thai places in the world. The food here is very consistent and always delicious. I love how its been family run since I started going here almost 10 years ago. Its hard to recommend anything on the menu because its all so good. The only thing I would warn you is that it can get quite busy so make sure you make reservations.

Honestly this is the best Thai food Ive ever had. My gf and I came in and every dish we ordered was phenomenal. I personally dont know how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars. Great picks are Oyster Beef, chicken saute, green curry and pad pew.

Came here for an early dinner and it was super busy. We were initially told that the restaurant was booked out for the night and we would have to do takeout. However, upon waiting 15 minutes, they kindly gave us a table. I ordered the Pad See Ew and a Thai Iced Tea and I was so impressed. The Pad See Ew was so flavourful and well made. My friends ordered the Pad Thai and they were really happy with their dish as well. This is honest the best Thai restaurant here in Vancouver and I cannot wait to go back and try their other dishes as well
The service was amazing they are friendly and the food is tasty, all the dishes were good and the quantity is ok for the price.

I like their Thai foods sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much! Their foods are all at great value and delicious! Highly recommend this place! I will be here again!

Sawssdee is our go-to for authentic thai food. Feel like home away from home. We are there othen for whenever I dont feel like to cook. Highly recommend pad thai with Tamarind sauce. It is the most authentic one I find in Vancouver. Reservations needed if you come on a weekend cause they quite busy or you might have to wait for hour like us. Servers and hostess are very friendly and he even remember what I ordered from the last time I went.
Overall good experience and tasty food. The place was busy late into the night on a Sunday and many regulars eating at this spot. Will be a place that I will go back again

Sawasdee serves one of the best and authentic Thai dishes. My table ordered total of five dishes and enjoyed every single one of them. I tried Cho Muang for the first time which was delicious!! The Tom Yum was certainly the best Tom Yum I have ever had  Both fried rice and Pad Thai was unique and scrumptious. And what more can I say about Coconut Curry  Each dish was less than 20 dollars with good amount of portions. Also I was very satisfied with the friendly, fast and efficient staff who were very accommodating and prompt to meet the customers  need. Our server was super attentive when taking our orders and answered our questions attentively. My experience in Sawasdee very memorable and satisfying. I cannot wait to go back as it has become my favorite Thai restaurant in Vancouver.
Customer service was excellent , spring was huge , every portion is big. Green curry definitely need to try , you can adjust the spicy level also beef was very soft with special sauce in the side.

Nothing like a meal at my fave Thai restaurant, Sawasdee. Ordered a few dishes and everything was so flavourful and on point. Order the garlic pork vs the beef. Each dish was about $17-20 each. Service was friendly, courteous and quick. Call for reservations as this place is buzzing!

We ordered Pad Thai, green curry, vegetables stir fry, pineapple fried rice and Thai iced tea. The pad Thai is the best I ever had. It was a well-balanced of sweet, sour and salty, and the noodles texture is also very good. I also loved the iced milk tea. Would definitely come back!
Overall food is above average, service is friendly, interior is so-so. Wouldn t say it s amazing, but good enough for Vancouver standard.

This restaurant is an old favourite of mine. Service here is great as is the atmosphere. This place has some great Thai decorations without being over the top. I almost always order the stuffed chicken wings and the duck red curry but today I opted for the chicken green curry and the tiger beef. The chicken curry was great but the beef was just a steak with a Thai dipping sauce - nothing I had ever seen in Thailand. The overall dining experience was still great and this meal didnt take away from the fact that this restaurant is consistently good.

Fantastic food and service. The staff is extremely kind, and the experience is authentic at it s core. I highly recommend the purple dumplings. After living in Thailand, I m surprised I never came across them before, so I expect they are quite unique to this restaurant. Also unique was the style of the Pad Kra Pao- it s usually minced but it was served in whole pieces and a delight nonetheless. A must try for Thai food lovers looking for a refreshing twist!

The crying tiger beef is so good and for sure the best thing on the menu, same with the panang curry. I feel like things tend to be a bit on the  sweeter  side of the Thai flavor profile here, but overall it s a very good spot, one of the best in Vancouver. The servers are also all very nice.

Very friendly service, good ambiance and food. Our group tried their stuffed fried chicken, tom yum soup with shrimp, green curry with chicken, coconut rice, and crying tiger beef (highly recommended).
I had dinner here with a friend after an exam and it was a great experience. The food was delicious and had great portions. Their Thai iced tea was very delicious. Would definitely come again.

Excellent service and food. Came right at 5:00 on a Thursday when they opened as we knew it would get very busy soon after we got a seat. Had BBQ squid, A Prawn & Cashew dish & a Deep fried fish with a sweet & sour sauce. All so good. Probably a top 5 best Thai in Vancouver for sure.

This place is always jam packed as they only open for dinner time. I recommend making a reservation early so you dont have to wait too long. They cater to meat eaters and vegetarians as well. One of the best veggie Thai food Ive had in greater Vancouver. One of the best things here is that the service is really good! The staff are quick and attentive, and the food comes out really quick. I highly recommend their appetizers, pad thai, and green curry.
food and service are both good

Very busy, popular ,service is fast and attentive with a smile. Food looks great...is very tasty and proportioned nicely. 2 of us ordered 2 appys..stuffed chicken wings  and BBQ squid ..1 main dish with a side of coconut rice. Tea and a Thai beer.  $42 + tax & tip.   Very worth it.. Definitely high recommendations for the little Thai eatery.

Such a patient server, very helpful with menu suggestions and made sure everything was exceeding expectations; it all did. 3 main dishes, an appetizer, sides and non alcoholic drinks was under $90. Amazing all around. The garlic beef and flower dumplings were particularly special. Cant wait to go back!
Twas really good, the yellow curry with beef was scrumptious as a well as the pad see ew. And surprisingly didnt break the bank. I will definitely return

Sawasdee Thai is my very favourite Thai restaurant - we have missed it so much since we moved to Deep Cove - so I was delighted when Hubby said he was going to be in the old Hood and would I like him to pick up some take-out!! OH HAPPY FRIDAY! I ordered all of our favourites by phone - had to get all of them since we are not able to go often. Every bite of every dish was delectable - such a treat!! Favourites include Tom Kah Gai soup with prawns, Yellow Curry Chicken, Cashew Chicken, Pad Thai Woon Sen with Prawns and soy sauce, Satay Chicken and Spring Rolls. Will definitely make a point of visiting in person or take-out more often when we are in Vancouver! Parking in the area can be a challenge on a busy night but well worth it.
Amazing food and good value for money

This place was excellent!! We didnt have reservations but they bent over backwards to help get us a table right away. Truly felt like a guest in their home. Wonderful friendly server and delicious food! Well be coming back for more all the way from Squamish. Wish we had a Thai food place like this in our town!!

ShawOpen wifi available Ordered the Thai iced tea, chicken satay, red curry with coconut rice and pad Thai I recommend coming early or making reservations, it fills up quickly Nice interior with ample seating Service is friendly, I would come back! This is a great place for Thai food

Incredible overall experience. Everything - ALL 6 dishes we ordered were cooked to perfection with attention to flavors textures and presentation. Dishes were also fairly priced and the service was above average. The taro rice pudding for dessert was PHENOMENAL!
Wonderful Thai restaurant and I returned few times already.

This is a very lively place to eat on a busy day. We ordered the chicken and cashew, pad thai, spring rolls, and shrimp with vegetable dishes. All of them were great.  If your a spice lover,  you wont be disappointed. You can also reduce the spice level. Seated with in 10 mins, and staff are attentive and often to return to tables to see how your doing with your meal. I do recommend to space out your appetizers from your mains. The restaurant has a tropical vibe to it. Not much of a waiting area but you wont be waiting long. Come with a empty stomach. If you drive here, best to try finding side street parking,  Main st is a difficult parking location.

Was looking for a Thai restaurant after moving to the area. Noticed the great reviews so gave it a shot. Bought enough food for two meals, but it was so good that we will need to sort something else out for lunches tomorrow. Great food. Good cost. Highly recommend!

Best ever thai food. I have been visiting Thailand from Bangkok to Phuket but never ate better authentic thai food as here. Fresh, delicious, tasty spices and ingredients. I had small Thom Ka and Red Duck Curry and I was freaking out and had to tip accordingly. A must in Vancouver. Enjoy!

I had an absolutely delicious meal at this restaurant. The portion sizes were great and I particularly enjoyed the crying tiger beef, green curry with chicken, and garlic pork. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who loves Thai food. Its definitely worth the money!
Best Thai meal I have ever had!! We were a table of 13 ppl and every single person was raving about the food!!! I ordered to - go before I left so I could enjoy it one more time the next day. Yum!!
Our go to spot for Thai food. Best tiger beef in town. Pad Thai is awesome too!
Such an authentic place with the best thai food I ve ever tried! Yellow curry- tastiest thing in the whole world and those purple dumpling have a special place in my heart now (and belly too)
Hands down the best Thai restaurant in Vancouver. Amazingly delicious food and drinks and wonderful ambiance. 100% recommend.
Amazing Thai food! The stuffed chicken wings were especially good and unique. The curry had lots of chicken, unlike many dishes in other Thai restaurants. Very pleasant experience overall!

We had a thank you dinner with a company I work for, Young Actors Project and the food, service and ambience was wonderful. I was not aware of this place before but now that I am I will definitely be back, LOVED it!!
Best authentic Thai in Vancouver. I crave the chicken pad Thai, red Thai curry and pork fried rice

I LOVED our meal at Sawasdee. I especially crave (and have tried to replicate) the crying tiger sauce with grilled steak. Lovely, warm staff and delicious food at a reasonable price, what more do you need? Can t wait to go back!
Authenthic and delicious Thai! Very good customer  service! Must try Tiger Beef!

The BEST Thai food in Vancouver! Weve been eating at the Sawasdee Thai for over 30 years. They consistently deliver delicious dishes and never disappoint!  Be sure to try the Garlic/Pepper Chicken (#30). PS best peanut sauce - hearty, sweet and flavourful and Phad Thai - noodle perfection. Dietary restrictions: Staff happily made all dishes gluten free for us! Kid-friendliness: Very family friendly
Food was delicious, services is amazing and the wait was not that long. You cannot go wrong with anything you order

Wonderful servers, very friendly! We had pad khee mao chicken with noodles, pad eggplant with rice, tom kha soup, and of course dessert had to be none other than mango sticky rice. Each dish delicious and very fresh! The malbec from tier one went very well with all of it. I found this restaurant to be much better than most other Thai restaurants in terms of food , service and ambience. I will definitely be back and I will definitely recommend it to others.

Love this place. My of my regular places to go for great Thai food. Got the BBQ squid, green chicken curry and coconut rice this time around. Excellent. Sawasdee, thanks for the great food and experience.

Great food. Definitely a place to come and share authentic Thai food. And one the places Im the most excited to come to whenever Im in to BC. Everything on the plate: pad thai both regular and tomatoe flavour, along with the garlic chicken and beef, crying tiger beef pieces, green beans, fried tofu and coconut rice and stuffed chicken. Although I would definitely get the curries next time especially the panaag, not the same without it. The pad Thai is savoury, and the garlic chicken and beef are the favourites. With the stuffed chicken being my least favourite. And all eaten with coconut rice adds so much different tastes to the whole meal along with the fried tofu and green beans being the lighter tastes. A rush of flavours will come at you. Although be ready to be paying a heft sum if you want a great meal like this. And be careful to add up the bill amongst yourselfs since we had problems last time and ended up over paying. Still great place. And a must try if you havent been.
Great food, fantastic service and good prices. Would recommend booking a table as this place can get busy! Will definitely be back again.
Yknow what. I finally found a decent Thai restaurant to go-to in Vancouver. Thank you for not using tomato and ketchup to make pad thai.
My favourite Thai restaurant! The restaurant is family owned, and their service is amazing! I love their tom yum. Generous portions and very fair prices.

We love this restaurant, the service is excellent and food is very good. Our favourite items to order is the stuffed chicken wings, duck curry, tamarind pad thai and basil pork. Honestly everything here is really delicious! Highly recommended! Vegetarian options: There is a good selection of vegetarian food Kid-friendliness: Is restaurant is very kid friendly. They have high chair available and delicious food that kids would like.
Great spot for Thai food. Their portions are huge and really delicious.
Great food, decent portions but somewhat expensive.
Excellent quality thai food and nice service :)
The Sawasdee is my favourite restaurant!! Its my top choice to go to in Vancouver. Ive been going there my whole life - it has been amazing for over 3 decades and is still going strong!
Our go-to Thai place in Vancouver. Tried a bunch and always come back to this place. Their tamarind pad Thai is yummy!

I ordered take-out. First of all, everyone working for this restaurant is an angel. They are so nice and welcoming it honestly made me anticipate hard for the food. And, yes, the food was SO GOOD. I had pad-thai and the Drunk Noodle (Idk what its called on the menu). Both were amazing! I recommend Sawasdee and I plan to visit again
YUM so good! There s a reason it s so busy!
Best Tom yum, pad Thai, and Mango sticky rice I ve ever had.
Sawasadee.. the place that made me meditate upon tasting the curry. best food experience of my life back around 2009-2010. thought i left a review before but these things seem to disappear.

First time here for our daughters birthday... What a treat, the food was amazing as well as the service , so attentive. The curries were excellent, especially the coconut curry inside the coconut Place was very clean and pride of food was very evident. Most definitely will be back.

This is the BEST Thai restaurant in Vancouver in my opinion,best flavour and portions!! Made with love :) the workers there are always so friendly and provide great service considering that they are literally ALWAYS  busy!! It s a must try :) Things I always get: -Crying tiger Beef (SOOO GOOD) -yellow curry -spring rolls -coconut rice -Tom Kah Soup -and their peanut sauce is the best hands down to me heheh

This is by far the best Thai Food in Metro Vancouver.  I live in Langley to come out here to eat, so it must be good!  The food is a 10 out of 10 and so is the service!  PLEASE OPEN FOR LUNCH AGAIN, I NEED MORE THAI FROM SAWASDEE!

Incredible!  We walked in tonight and they had a table for us right away and we had a time limit because they were going to be a full house past 6:30, And we gladly took it. We werent even an hour;  food came out so incredibly fast we were happily shocked and it was soo fresh. Tom Kah Soup with chicken is my go to everywhere & its a healthy and delicious comfort food/ having been first time here I was so satisfied with the flavour and the cool mushrooms ... theyre called straw mushrooms. They resemble olives but are mushrooms.(never had those mushrooms but love them) The #67 I believe it was and I cant remember but it was a seafood dish.  Soo fresh & the popular pad thai the server suggested was fantastic. It wasnt the red one but the other dish. Just ask for the most popular pad thai.. anyways!  We ate and left before 6:30 & continued on our road trip.    My husband would be thrilled so Im going to try and take him here as soon as we can.  The baby in belly loved the dishes to hehe.

We came here when it was superbly busy (I believe there were some Christmas dinners happening!) We just came back from a trip to Thailand and my husband and I were craving Thai food. We ordered the Tom Yum soup, papaya salad, pineapple rice and chicken cashew. Everything was SO delicious and the service is also great. Overall very pleased! I can t wait to come back :)

The food is extremely  flavourful and has the best customer service ever. We ordered a bunch of dishes and even though there was one order that got mixed up, Matt the owner went above and beyond to rectify the situation. We loved the pineapple fried rice and and pad Thai  with prawns. Will be ordering again for takeout. Thanks Matt for taking care of us.
This place is an absolute must go to. The Tom Kah soup is the best thing ive ever tried jn my life. And the tiger beef is also just so damn good. Must must must.
Lovely staff and the best Thai food in Vancouver.
Delicious thai food in Vancouver. Highly recommend it. Make sure to make a reservation as they get full very fast.

Came here trying to satisfy my Thai Food craving and had a great time with a stuffed stomach! Place was recommended by a friend when I asked about Thai restaurants. This place is usually known as busy so be prepared to wait or make a reservation. You can also order take out I believe. We got lucky and were seated right away for 2. Knowing what we wanted, we were able to order right away as they checked on us after refilling our water. Our food came out within 8 minutes and we were eating right away! We got the Pad Thai w/ Tamarind Sauce, Sawasdee Fried Rice, and the Yellow Chicken Curry. Everything we got was full of flavor, juiciness and heat. Enjoyed all that we ordered and will come back for more. Also, the waters on our table were constantly filled. They are slightly more in the pricier side is the only negative thing i can say.

Our favourite Thai restaurant in town.  Wonderful family run place, supremely friendly staff and very good sized portions.  We always get the stuffed chicken wings as an appetizer, very unique and delicious.  Pad Thai is excellent here but be sure to get the tamarind sauce, not the ketchup based sauce so commonly found.  Crying tiger beef is also one of our faves, you can always request to adjust the spice level as needed.  Make sure to call ahead for a reservation, this place gets super busy.

This is our go to Thai spot in the city. Authentic and delicious Thai food. The service is always great - friendly and accommodating. The only downside of this place is they are not opened during lunch time!
Best Thai food I have ever had! Their purple dumplings are to die for.
This is my favourite Thai place in the lower mainland ever!!! You gotta eat here :) <3
Never had a bad experience with this place great food the only downside is theyre super busy so if you really want to go make sure you get a reservation in super worth it

The place was quite full but we were seated almost immediately. The staff were all very friendly. The menu was quite large but broken into sections: chicken, beef, seafood, chefs suggestions. The food was quickly served - about 10 minutes from when we ordered. We ordered the chicken satay, sweet and sour deep fried fish, and chicken stir fry and all was absolutely fantastic! Rice is served separate, which we actually appreciated. All in all - the two of us ordered, ate home made tasting Thai food, and paid the bill within 30 minutes. Highly recommend!

In my opinion Sawasdee Thai is the best Thai restaurant in Vancouver that we have been to. We have eaten there twice and the food was extremely delicious, huge portions and reasonable priced... in fact we thought it was some ways cheaper than many other restaurants. They have plenty of options for vegetarians and not one dish has disappointed so far, although I thought their peanut sauce was a little too sweet. But the service is very good and quick . and by that I mean REALLY QUICK!! You order and the food comes to you in less than 10mins, but I am not sure if that was because of the items we chose to order. In fact we even got some ideas to cook Thai food at home from their menu like the spinach and tofu in peanut sauce. The ambience is also good; I would go there especially in the summer because they have skylight over the seating area in the front that I think would be a great delight to eat under. Too bad they are not open for lunch on weekends but I guess that s their way to show that they care for the staff as much as they do for the customers and give them a break weekend mornings. Very impressed overall  I would recommend this place to everyone that loves Thai food.

This is my most favourite Thai food restaurant of allll time! Since I was living in the area I often ordered here. I love their Pad Thai, curry..basically everything tastes amazing. And the people working at Sawadee are so nice and they provide the best services. Please stay open forever. I literally recommend all my friends to come here if they want the best Thai food. I tried many Thai restaurants but only this restaurant offers both amazing tastes and fair pricing!

Best Thai restaurant in Vancouver. I ve been coming here for years. Great portions. Awesome flavours. Neat and friendly service. I never get disappointed. They keep up their high quality and they take good care of their customers.

Without a doubt, BEST THAI FOOD I HAVE EVER HAD! I struggled to find Thai food that compares to Sawasdee anywhere I have travelled to which includes all over Thailand. Their curries (in particular the red curry), coconut rice and pad thai are truly exceptional as are their generous portions and incredibly professional and kind staff. This is my favourite restaurant in the entire world and I recommend anyone in BC who enjoys delicious Thai food to make the trek to Sawasdee, you deserve it. :)
Great good, service and pricing. I highly recommend getting reservations as this place can be quite busy during peak hours.

You know you re in good hands when you look around and there are classical Thai paintings on the walls and a Thai shrine in the back. This place is phenomenal. Usually I m lukewarm about Pad Thai but the dish here is just on another level from what I ve ever had. The menu is expansive with lots of delicious-looking options. Green Curry was also amazing. Can t wait to go back and try some other things out on the menu!
Best place to enjoy a thai meal with friends and family. The food is absolutely delightful.  The service is amazing. My tummy always leaves happy thank you Sawadi Thai

We went with two friends last night - who knew it well. We spend 5 months in Thailand every year, so we reckon we know our Thai food....... The food was just scrumptious - and the portions almost too generous. Service was tops too. It is really a great restaurant, and the food was pretty well as good as Thailand. Well be back.
Great food.  Spring rolls, red.curry, pineapple rice and pad thai were all flavorful and decent amount of prawns and chicken.  Beer was ice cold. Definitely go back again.

We love Thai food and only discovered this restaurant a few months ago and wow - it is Thai food on another level! Suffice it to say we are now regulars. We often get takeout but eating in is a great experience too. The service is knowledgeable and friendly and they re always ready to make recommendations if we want to try something new. It s our forever favourite Thai restaurant!
Fireworks on the palate. Extremely tasty Thai food. Parking can be a bit of an issue, but allow yourself time because the food is well worth it.
Great service and food. Took my boyfriend here for his 27th birthday and he LOVED it. Very special place. Will be back.

I cannot say enough about this place. The owners are amazing and always so welcoming. Make sure you try everything you can because honestly, Ive never had a bad dish here. I love their pad Thai, yellow Currey, green beans, crying beef etc. Do yourself a favor and keep coming back to try more and more of their delicious food.

Went first time with my colleague. Their food is delicious. I tried Thai Currey with Rice, Eggplant and Mixed Veg Noodles. It is one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. The place was cozy and servers were friendly and they took no time to serve the food. I am a vegetarian so they explain me the ingredients. At the end they gave everyone a Thank you Candy.

Best Thai food in Vancouver by far, this place has outstanding food and 5 star service. One of our favourite restaurants, this family owned and operated business is fantastic. We try and get there for dinner once a week. Get there early or make reservations, this place gets busy. Wish I could give it more stars, it really really is that good!
